repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.unittitle: IBT Research Department records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: International Brotherhood of Teamsters, Chauffeurs, Warehousemen, and Helpers of America

did.abstract: This collections contains the International Brotherhood of Teamsters Research Department records dating from 1941-1983. The majority of the material pertains to research conducted by the IBT's Research Department into various companies and their contracts. The materials include correspondence, copies of labor contracts, statistics, reports, news clippings, hearing transcripts.
did.physloc: Materials are stored off-site, and will require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into five series: Company Files, Senate Hearings, History Files, State Historical Society of Wisconsin Files, and Reports.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collections contains the International Brotherhood of Teamsters Research Department records dating from 1941-1983. The majority of the material pertains to research conducted by the IBT's Research Department into various companies and their contracts. The materials include correspondence, copies of labor contracts, statistics, reports, news clippings and photographs.

The collection also contains materials produced by the Senate Committee on Governmental Affairs Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations dating from February 17 - November 3, 1981. Included are full hearing transcripts as well as reports and individual statement transcripts. Investigation topics include organized crime in the waterfront industry and government efforts to combat labor racketeering.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The IBT Research Department was a department of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters between 1941 and 1983. The purpose of the department was to conduct research of companies associated with the Teamsters and political affairs.

did.unittitle: Company Files

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by company name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains materials dating from 1941-1983 related to research conducted by the IBT's Research Department into various companies and their contracts. The materials include correspondence, copies of labor contracts, statistics and reports, news clippings and photographs.

Senate Hearings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series cotains materials produced by the Senate Committee on Governmental Affairs Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations dating from February 17 - November 3, 1981. Included are full hearing transcripts as well as reports and individual statement transcripts. Investigation topics include organized crime in the waterfront industry and government efforts to combat labor racketeering.

History Files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains collected Teamsters and general labor history files from the IBT Research Department. The materials date from 1908-2000, and include articles, reports, general correspondence, Teamsters bibliographies and filmographies, news clippings and magazines. Also included is numerous correspondence and legal proceedings produced by the Teamsters' court-appointed Board of Monitors.

State Historical Society of Wisconsin Files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains materials from the State Historical Society of Wisconsin labor history archive. One half of the series is comprised of printouts of microfilmed correspondence from the American Federation of Labor, International Brotherhood of Teamsters, and other labor organizations, dating from 1907-1952. The other half of the series dates from 1968-2003 and is comprised of guides to SHSW labor history collections and microfilm records as well as correspondence between the Teamsters and the SHSW concerning the creation and operation of the archive.
